title.label: No guides. No instructions. No idea how to play

content.label:
Seriously. There's nothing in this "game" (and I use the word "game" very loosely) that gives you any kind of instructions or help or even tells you what in the hell you're supposed to do. There's nothing that tells you how things work. The interface is clunky and hard to control. Devs, is it too much to give us a little onscreen guidance and instructions??

Yeah, okay. So there's a sign that tells you how to create a homunculus: place egg in cup, tap with the hammer -- and the very misleading "instructions" on the hammer screen are no help.  Tapping too fast to fill the bar up top will cause you to break the egg if you tap too many times, and then you're stuck on a screen with no egg, a hypodermic, and a box of bandages. I finally figured out that swiping the screen takes me to a shelf screen, and after much trial and error, I figured out how to get more eggs -- a process that takes too many steps. 

Evidently clicking on "wild bird eggs" in the Homun Store isn't complicated enough for the devs. After you buy the eggs, you then have to click on the egg carton, click on the egg, then select "take"...which finally loads them in the bowl on the first screen.

So, back to the first screen. Again, after too much trial & error, I got the hammer to work without breaking the egg, injected the egg with potion, covered it with a bandage ...waited a few seconds, and a green human-thing appeared on the table. 

Ooookay. Now what? Tapping all over the page did nothing. Picking up the green thing and dropping it in the bowl gave me a green thing in the bowl. There's no onscreen help, no guidance, no instructions, not even a basic tutorial. Just a green thing in the bowl, with your hammer, hypo, and bandages (all of which only knock Greenie down if you try to use them on him). 

Back to the Homun Store I went. More eggs. Created more green things. Finally unlocked another screen -- have no idea how I did it -- of a gray table. Managed to drag and drop a couple Greenies on the gray table. Nothing. They stood there. 

Tapping all over the screen & on the red box above the table gave me...something. No clue what it was supposed to be: a row of slashed-circle icons. A chance swipe got me to a "toolbox", where I found a knife. Not that it helped.

DEVS, GIVE US A TUTORIAL. GIVE US SOME ONSCREEN HELP. GIVE US **ANYTHING** THAT LETS US KNOW THE BASIC GAMEPLAY.

So. No tutorial, no help, a clunky interface, an overly-complicated store that gives you no help in using it, ugly graphics that look like the worst of 1980s CGI, nothing that gives you any clue what to do next or even how to play. Forget this game. It's nothing but a boring exercise in frustration.
It’s good but the bowl is just there I can’t do anything with it
Play it and see
Why is the first mission so difficult'!!!!!!!

A very unique game, and I would personally LOVE to see it go further!

Now with the issues: 1. The weapons and objects are glitchy. When you try to use the knife in the way it says in the message on screen, it just shoots around in a random direction. 2. It would be cool if it had more color or variety, as well as more detail, such as blood, guts, and dismemberment of homunculi. 3. Better translation would be nice, or just more proofreading and typo assessment. 4. An arena for homunculi to fight and compete, or a global leader board of scores. If there were more options when creating the homunculi, there could even be tournaments between players!

All in all, a very good game, with SO MUCH POTENTIAL! Though I am sad to see it unfulfilled.
God speed, and good luck on future projects and updates!

I love that you can create life and it feels like one big middle finger to god, evolution and Charles Darwin. So thanks it really brings out a creepy vibe one criticism I have is that it needs to be more interactive.
